turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Feeling This.
turn.1: What was the recording process like for the album Feeling This?
turn.2: On the first day of pre-production on the album, bassist Mark Hoppus asked an engineer to explain Pro Tools to him, as it was the first time the band would record their music digitally.
turn.4: He began recording guitar and bass parts and experimenting with the software.
turn.6: When guitarist Tom DeLonge and drummer Travis Barker arrived, they too began adding new tracks to the project.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The song was written in one day. "I think if I sit there and try to analyze everything, what would be cool here or there, I just feel like I get so far away from what I would do, and I think your gut instinct is usually the best thing," said Barker at the time.
turn.10: The lyrics were written with Hoppus and DeLonge going into separate rooms—Hoppus writing the choruses and DeLonge writing the verses.
turn.11: Is there anything else interesting about the recording process?
turn.12: The two had not spoken to each other about the lyrics ahead of time, and it turned out that the two had both written about sex.
